content: I think representation is crucial in literature and media, as it allows us to see ourselves and our experiences reflected in the stories being told. It's especially important for marginalized communities to have their voices and stories represented, as it helps to humanize and validate their experiences. When we see ourselves in the stories we read or watch, it can be incredibly empowering and help us feel less alone. On the other hand, the lack of representation can be alienating and perpetuate harmful stereotypes. I'm curious, do you have any recommendations for books or authors that tackle themes of identity and representation in innovative ways?
